titles.title: Moratorium on United States Postal Facilities Act

To amend title 39, United States Code, to provide that the United States Postal Service may not close, consolidate, or sell any historic postal facility without prior congressional approval, and for other purposes.
Moratorium on United States Postal Facilities Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

bill.summary:
Moratorium on United States Postal Facilities Act
Prohibits the U.S. Postal Service from closing, consolidating, selling, or otherwise disposing of any historic postal facility without prior written approval from the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs of the Senate.
Defines "historic postal facility" as any postal facility listed, or eligible to be listed, in the National Register of Historic Places.
